intro: Xanthophyllum burkillii, commonly known as the Burkill's goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow inflorescences, which are clustered in dense, showy groups. It typically grows in open woodland or savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
